image.altText: A close up shot of a woman wearing a white blazer and black and white shirt.

props.synopsis: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has called on the federal government to intervene in the NT's Central Land Council after revelations about the criminal history of its chair Warren Williams.

title.children: Senator calls for land council probe after chair's criminal past revealed

image.altText: Group

props.synopsis: Around 50 prison officers have marched to parliament to protest against the NT government's plan to hire private contractors within its corrections system.

title.children: NT prison guards push back on plan to privatise corrections jobs

image.altText: A police vehicle parked in front of a house painted in green.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have charged a man with murder after a woman was killed in an alleged domestic violence incident in Alice Springs on Sunday.

title.children: Man charged with murder after Alice Springs woman found dead

image.altText: A generic image of two NT Police officers at work on the streets.

props.synopsis: The NT government is introducing a new law which grants police "express powers" to enter private property to search for parole or domestic violence offenders.

title.children: Police to conduct alcohol testing on private property in DV law change

image.altText: The front of the Alice Springs police station.

props.synopsis: Two Aboriginal women held in the Alice Springs watch house have described the "disgusting" conditions, saying cells are so full inmates sometimes have to share mattresses.

title.children: Peak Aboriginal bodies say Alice Springs watch house conditions 'inhumane'

image.altText: A woman addresses the media in a press confernece.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has joined all other jurisdictions in establishing a lobbyist register. It comes as the government also defunds two influential environmental groups.

title.children: NT government creates lobbyist register, defunds environment groups

image.altText: crocodile in a river.

props.synopsis: Scientists and tour guides say crocodiles in Queensland's north are hiding from the heat as temperatures warm, potentially disrupting their ability to hunt and travel.

title.children: Crocodiles struggle to hunt, survive in warmer northern waters

image.altText: A sign telling visitors not to enter the property

props.synopsis: Farmers are celebrating the federal government's decision to withdraw the proposed biosecurity levy bill, which would have seen $50 million per year collected from the agricultural sector.

title.children: Biosecurity levy proposal scrapped in 'huge win' for farmers

image.altText: An Aboriginal family standing in a supermarket (man, woman and child), holding a trolley.

props.synopsis: As remote communities across Australia wait to find out whether they'll receive federal government help to reduce grocery prices, the NT's largest Indigenous community is finding its own solutions to limit food inflation.

title.children: As remote communities wait for government food support, this town has its own solutions

image.altText: Gallagher speaks on the senate floor.

props.synopsis: A proposal that would allow parents access to three days of subsidised child care has been fast-tracked through the Senate. Follow live.

title.children: Eleventh-hour rush to ram child care bill through Senate

image.altText: Shorten stands speaking in the prime minister's courtyard.

props.synopsis: A speechwriter hired on a $600,000, two-year contract to write speeches for Services Australia and its minister Bill Shorten, has joined him at his new job at the University of Canberra.

title.children: Bill Shorten's $300k speechwriter follows him to UC

image.altText: Helicopter as seen from Sue Marshall's Pieman Heads shack during the February fires on the west coast of Tasmania

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian town of Zeehan and other coastal communities are in the path of bushfires, with the residents of one tiny town saying they'll take to the beach if things get too bad.

title.children: Bushfires bearing down on communities in Tasmania's west

image.altText: A car caught in a flash flood while a 4WD ploughs through water behind.

props.synopsis: Although February is still peak severe weather season, the majority of extreme events this month are being exacerbated by abnormally warm waters off our coastlines.

title.children: Australia facing heatwaves, drenching and cyclones

image.altText: An aboriginal woman with black hair looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Leonie Ebsworth was around 19 years old and enjoying a night at the Empress Hotel in Redfern, New South Wales, when a man approached her and said the impossible.

title.children: 'You're my sister': The words that untangled a stolen childhood

image.altText: Brielle holds her daughter as she looks off a balcony.

props.synopsis: Apartment living is a key pillar of government plans to ease the housing crisis but some have questioned the viability of the plans, saying the current stock of apartments was poorly suited for families.

title.children: Could a high-rise apartment replace the classic family home?

image.altText: houses at a port

props.synopsis: Port Hedland's deputy mayor says the town is among the most prepared in the world for a category five cyclone, but there are fears for houses that haven't been well maintained.

title.children: How ready is Port Hedland for a category five cyclone?

image.altText: A drone shot of a plot of land

props.synopsis: While residents want a say in housing projects in their communities, urban planners say a negativity bias is resulting in affordable housing projects being blocked.

title.children: Urban planners say community consultation has a NIMBY problem

image.altText: an aerial photo shows yellow excavators amid grey rubble by the side of a giant sinkhole in Yashio

props.synopsis: A driver whose truck was swallowed by a sinkhole two weeks ago is yet to be found, as authorities say it could take three months to access the site near Tokyo.

title.children: Rescuers battle sewage in hunt for truck driver swallowed by sinkhole

image.altText: Commonwealth Bank chief executive Matt Comyn looks at the camera in an office setting.

props.synopsis: Banks are prohibited from telegraphing rates moves in advance, but it doesn't take much reading between the lines to see that an RBA rate cut next week will be passed on in full.

title.children: CBA boss 'acutely aware' customers expect rate cuts to be passed on

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The S&P/ASX2000 hit an all-time intra-day high on Thursday. This is a despite a tumble on Wall Street after hotter-than-expected consumer price data. Half-year results drop for insurance giant IAG, Origin Energy. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX hits intra-day high, IAG and Origin report strong profits

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Elon Musk's X agrees to pay $US10m to settle Trump lawsuit
Severe cyclone shuts down parts of WA's iron-ore industry
Why are shares in IAG down off the back of strong results?

image.altText: A researcher holds a pipette under a microscope.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers dependent on US funding are facing an uncertain future as the Trump administration attempts to slash funding and slap restrictions on medical and scientific research.

title.children: Trump funding cuts leave Australian researchers in limbo

image.altText: A composite image of two men, both in suits, looking on.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin invited Donald Trump to Moscow and discussed negotiating an end to the war in Ukraine during a Wednesday phone call.

title.children: Trump, Putin discuss ending Ukraine war and Moscow visit in rare call

image.altText: A school zone sign

props.synopsis: The report found a now-convicted teacher was allowed to keep working for years after they were was seen inappropriately touching a student.

title.children: Damning report finds Victorian education department failed sex abuse victims

image.altText: The female humpback anglerfish was spotted during a shark research expedition.

props.synopsis: The footage was captured on a shark research trip off the Canary Islands.

title.children: Footage shows rare deep-sea 'black seadevil' fish near ocean surface

image.altText: A Caucasian young woman sits at a table in a cafe looking at her tablet with pen in hand and medical books on table

props.synopsis: Gambling among younger Australians is often associated with men making bets online or at the pub with their mates, but research – and the lived experience of young women – shows that is not always the case.

title.children: Ella never thought one bet would end up costing her thousands of dollars

image.altText: A white two-storey house with sprawling garden, green grass.

props.synopsis: Recently ousted Delhi leader Arvind Kejriwal was once touted as "the new moral force in Indian politics". But an estimated $6.2 million upgrade of the chief minister's residence at the taxpayer's expense has taken the shine off his honesty badge.

title.children: Could a $6m reno of his 'Glass Palace' have cost India's anti-corruption champ the Delhi election?

image.altText: A french fry is dipped in a small glass container with tomato sauce.

props.synopsis: Keeping tomato sauce in the fridge after opening is the best approach, experts say, even though the food safety risk is relatively low.

title.children: Pantry or fridge? Where to store tomato sauce and other condiments

image.altText: A closeup of a woman with dark hair in a bun looking down, wearing a black coat in front of grey sky.

props.synopsis: Never before has an Australian sportswoman been embroiled in as high profile a scandal as the one Sam Kerr finds herself in now, writes national sport reporter David Mark.

title.children: Sam Kerr's racial harassment trial is a turning point for Australian sport

image.altText: Storm CEO Justin Rodski and NRL CEO Andrew Abdo standing next to each other in a press conference

props.synopsis: The NRL will reignite expansion talks with the Western Australian government following next month's state election, as league boss Andrew Abdo remains confident the competition can expand to 20 teams.

title.children: NRL to resume Perth talks after March state election

image.altText: Tennis player Elena Rybakina sits next to coach Stefano Vukov, who is talking and gesturing with his hand.

props.synopsis: Elena Rybakina's former coach, Stefano Vukov, says he "never abused anyone" as the women's tennis tour upholds his ban.

title.children: Wimbledon winner 'disappointed' after former coach's ban upheld by WTA

image.altText: A black and white elon  musk stands in front of the X logo

props.synopsis: The number of posts containing slurs doubled and the number of bot accounts also increased, new research by a California team suggests.

title.children: Erase bots or 'die trying': Elon Musk's broken promise for X

image.altText: A young woman with dyed blonde hair and bright pink eyeshadow sings into a microphone

props.synopsis: Love in a reality TV singing competition; South Korean family obligation; tender Belgium coming of age; RPG escapism — our picks from the 2025 Mardi Gras Film Festival.

title.children: Forget Emilia Pérez and check out this unhinged French musical instead
